content: If checked all new users will receive welcome letter. Available only when Mail Attribute is mapped to LDAP.

comment.text: This translation key is used for the tooltip that explains when checking "LdapSendWelcomeLetter" enables sending welcome letters to new users, available only when a specific mail attribute is mapped to LDAP. It appears as a HelpButton in an Advanced Settings section of the PortalSettings page.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ميزة البريد" (Mail Attribute) is not the most natural way to express 'Mail Attribute' in this context. A more accurate translation would convey that the mail functionality is linked or associated with LDAP.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: إذا تم تحديده، فسيتلقى جميع المستخدمين الجدد خطاب ترحيب. يتوفر فقط عند ربط خاصية البريد بـ LDAP.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While not a major issue, using a colon (:) after 'LDAP' in both the English and Arabic versions would ensure consistency in formatting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: إذا تم تحديده، فسيتلقى جميع المستخدمين الجدد خطاب ترحيب. يتوفر فقط عند ربط خاصية البريد بـ LDAP:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "If checked" is not accurately translated. "İşarələndikdə" is a literal translation of "when checked" but doesn't flow naturally. A better translation would reflect the 'checked' state enabling the feature.
The word 'Available' is not naturally translated to 'əlçatandır'. A more natural phrasing is required.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Təkcə Poçt Xüsusiyyəti LDAP-a uyğunlaşdırıldıqda aktivdir.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'приветстващо' (privetstvasho) should be 'поздравително' (pozdravitelno) which is the more common and accurate translation for 'welcome' in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ако е отметнато, всички нови потребители ще получат поздравително писмо.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Χαρακτηριστικό Αλληλογραφίας" is a literal translation of "Mail Attribute" and may be too technical or unclear for the target audience.  A more user-friendly translation might be preferable.

While technically correct, "επιστολή καλωσορίσματος" (welcome letter) could be more naturally translated as something like "email καλωσορίσματος" or "μήνυμα καλωσορίσματος" to reflect modern communication.
The English phrase 'If checked' is better translated as 'Si está marcada' rather than 'Si se marca'. 'Se marca' is passive voice and doesn't quite capture the active nature of checking a box.
The term 'Mail Attribute' is literally translated as 'atributo de correo'. While understandable, 'Atributo de Correo Electrónico' would be more precise and professional in this context.

The term "Փոստի հատկանիշը" (Posti hatkanishi) is a literal translation of "Mail Attribute".  While understandable, it's not the most natural phrasing in Armenian. A more natural term for "Mail Attribute" in this context might be something like "Էլեկտրոնային փոստի տվյալը" (Elektronayin posti tvyaly) or simply "ծածկագրային էլեկտրոնային փոստը" (tsadkagravayin eleqtronayin posty).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing "Փոստի հատկանիշը" to "Էլեկտրոնային փոստի տվյալը" or "ծածկագրային էլեկտրոնային փոստը" for better flow and naturalness.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The colon after "LDAP-ին" should ideally be a dash to match the English source. "LDAP-ին:" implies a direct translation of the English colon, which is not common in Armenian phrasing.

The phrase "Available only when Mail Attribute is mapped to LDAP" is not accurately conveyed. The Japanese translation focuses on validity rather than availability. A more literal and accurate translation would clarify the dependency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: メール属性がLDAPにマッピングされている場合にのみ利用可能です。(Mēru shison ga LDAP ni mapping sa rete iru baai nomi ni riyō kanō desu.)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure could be slightly improved for better flow in Japanese. Separating the two conditions (checking the box and dependency on Mail Attribute mapping) would enhance readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: チェックした場合、すべての新規ユーザにウェルカムレターが送信されます。ただし、メール属性がLDAPにマッピングされている場合にのみ有効です。(Chekku shita baai, subete no shinki yūza ni werukamu retā ga sōshin sa remasu. Tatoeba, mēru shison ga LDAP ni mapping sa rete iru baai ni nomi yūkō desu.)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ຖ້າມາຢັ້ງຢືນ" is not the most natural way to say "If checked". A more natural phrasing would be "ຖ້າກວດກາ" or "ຖ້າເລືອກເອົາ".

The wording "ສະບັບນີ້ໃຊ້ໄດ້ເມື່ອຄຸນນະພາບອີເມລ໌ຖືກນໍາໃຊ້ກັບ LDAPເທົ່ານັ້ນ" is a bit clunky. "ຄຸນນະພາບອີເມລ໌" isn't quite right. It’s referring to the mapping. It translates more literally to "email quality".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ມັນໃຊ້ໄດ້ເມື່ອຄຸນນະພາບອີເມລ໌ຖືກນໍາໃຊ້ກັບ LDAP ຢ່າງດຽວເທົ່ານັ້ນ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Jeśli opcja jest zaznaczona' could be more concise and natural. While grammatically correct, it feels slightly verbose.
The English phrase 'If checked' is slightly more conversational than 'Jeśli opcja jest zaznaczona'. While not incorrect, it loses some nuance.
The Romanian translation uses a colon after 'Dacă opțiunea este bifată' which is not present in the English version.  While not strictly incorrect, it alters the flow and is stylistically different.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the colon after 'Dacă opțiunea este bifată'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'If checked' is awkwardly translated as 'යොමුවූවා නම්'. A more natural translation would be 'ප්‍රදේශිය තීරුණිසිට්ඨය ප überprüfen කර'.
The term 'new users' is translated as 'නව පරිශීලකයින්'. While technically correct, a more natural phrasing would be 'නව යුවෙක්කාරයන්'.
The phrase 'welcome letter' is translated as 'පිළිගැනීමේ ලිස්තුවක්'.  A more accurate and commonly used term in this context would be 'එ පිළිගැනීම ලිපිය'.

The phrase 'Available only when Mail Attribute is mapped to LDAP' is translated as 'මෙය, තැපැල් ගුණාංගය LDAP වෙත සකස් කර ඇති විට පමණක් ලබා ගත හැකිය.'. This translation is slightly verbose and could be simplified. A better option would be 'තැපැල් ගුණාංගය LDAP වෙත සම්බන්ධ කර ඇති විට පමණක් ලබා ගත හැකිය'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: තැපැල් ගුණාංගය LDAP වෙත සම්බන්ධ කර ඇති විට පමණක් ලබා ගත හැකිය

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation uses 'Ak je táto možnosť zapnutá' which translates to 'If this option is enabled'. While not incorrect, it's slightly more formal than the English's 'If checked'. Consider a slightly less formal wording.
The translation uses a period (.) after 'Na voljo samo,' which isn't consistent with the English phrasing. The English doesn't end the sentence there.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Na voljo le, če je poštni atribut preslikan v LDAP.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "ц́е" is a ligature that can be confusing. It's better to use the standard "ће".
The word "Mejl" is a transliteration and not a proper Serbian word. The correct word is "Mejl" or 'Email'.
The phrase "će dobiti" could be more naturally rendered as "primaće".
The translation uses a period (.) after 'yazısı' which is not typical in Turkish for tooltips. It makes the sentence feel more formal than the English original.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the period after 'yazısı'. The corrected sentence would be: 'İşaretlenirse tüm yeni kullanıcılar hoş geldiniz yazısı alır. Yalnızca Posta Özelliği LDAP ile eşleştirildiğinde kullanılabilir.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of 'Available only when Mail Attribute is mapped to LDAP' is not entirely accurate. A more natural phrasing would capture the meaning of restriction.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Доступно лише за умови прив’язки атрибуту пошти до LDAP.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Mail Attribute" is translated as "Thuộc Tính Thư". While technically correct, it's slightly awkward. A more natural translation for "Mail Attribute" in this context might be "Thuộc Tính Bưu Điện" or "Thuộc Tính Email".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change "Thuộc Tính Thư" to "Thuộc Tính Bưu Điện" or "Thuộc Tính Email".
